result.execSummary:
The defendant David C Paschen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done. Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge due within 1 year of release from custody.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  Court recommends Day Reporting Center or electronic monitoring. Sentence may be served in Ozaukee County if accepted.
Consecutive to: to any sentence
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David C Paschen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David C Paschen in court with attorney Mark A Langholz.  Defendant David C Paschen in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  


Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 0 days served; Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  Court recommends Day Reporting Center or electronic monitoring.     

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge due within 1 year of release from custody.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Sentence may be served in Ozaukee County if accepted.
Defendant David C Paschen in court with attorney Mark A. Langholz.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David C Paschen in court with attorney Mark Langholz.  Defendant David C Paschen in custody.  Paul Hauer for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense's Demand for Discovery and Inspection,  received and filed.

Attorney Mark Langholz in court, defendant David C Paschen not in court, in custody.  Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for Hannah Kolberg for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is in Ozaukee County and was NOT PRODUCED.  Case adjourned for cause.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-12-2014 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David C Paschen in court with Student Intern Michael Beckman under the supervision ofattorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant David C Paschen in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
